article: The first day of college I met a little old lady. I was _ . "Why are you here at such a young age?" I asked. "To meet a rich husband, get married , have children, and then retire and travel!" she replied _ . I laughed, but we became close friends. For the whole _ we would leave class together and _ nonstop. I was always listening as she _ her wisdom and experience. At the end of the term Rose was invited to make a _ . I'll never forget her words. "We do not stop playing because we are old; we grow old _ because we stop playing. The only _ of staying young is being happy and achieving success. You have to find humor and _ . You've got to have a(n) _ . When you lose dreams, you die. We have so many people walking around who are _ and don't even know it! Growing older doesn't _ growing up. Anybody can grow older doing _ . That doesn't take any talent or ability. My idea is that one grows up by always finding _ in life. Have no regrets. The elderly don't have regrets for what we did, but rather for things we didn't do. The only people who fear death are those with _ ." The college year ended. Rose got her _ but passed away one week after graduation. Many students attended the funeral of the _ woman who taught by _ : never too late to be all you can possibly be.
